• How do you onboard and off board your customers?

    • Onboarding Details: Deployment Page
    • Offboarding Details: (Documentation)

  • How do you support your customers?

    • Ticket Creation via Portal, Emails
    • No telephone support





  • What is your CSM program, if any?

  • Timezone's covered?


Telephone Support

We can provide urgent telephone support to DeskDirector customers in the following locations:

  • New Zealand
  • Australia
  • USA
  • Canada
  • UK

This support will be offered for P1 emergency issues only (Site Down) and be staffed by our 24x7 team to diagnose the issue, simply log the ticket, resolve where possible or escalate to on-call Level 3 technical team members.


For each region the is a monthly cost of ~NZ$25 + GST per number

Inbound calling rates are ~NZ$0.12 + GST per minute

pages.title: Standard Change Management Form
pages.name: Standard Change Management Form

pages.title: Change Management Grading
pages.name: Change Management Grading
pages.pageContent:
Framework:


  • Who are the parties?

    • Customers
    • Employee (s)
    • Techs (engineers)
    • Vendors
    • Other 3rd parties ￼
  • What needs to be approved?
  • Who needs to approve it?

  • Impact of Change (Successful)
  • Risk of unsuccessful￼

  • Who will be effected?

    • All/some of the people
    • All/some of the time￼
  • Is there a roll back plan?
  • Where/ what is the roll back plan?
  • Will there be interruption of services?
  • What interruptions would these be?￼￼Depending on scale:￼
  • Black hat scenario <if it turns all bad>
  • Yellow hat scenario





Grading


A change request allows you to implement a controlled process for the addition, modification, or removal of approved and supported configuration items (CIs). A change request records the detailed information about the change, such as the reason of the change, the priority, the risk, the type of change, and the change category


Type Description Priority Scenarios Comms Plan Authorisation Path Escalation path
Standard A standard change is a pre-authorised change that is low risk, relatively common and follows a specified procedure or work instruction.

P3 & P4
  • Software update (eg AV)
  • Site updates.
  • Software shipping.
  • Hardware upgrades.
  • Changes in instance.
  • Security changes.
  • Basic (tell me when it is done, document it along the way).
  • Have a log report of standard changes.
  • No approval required, however we are to communicate what change we are implementing and WHY.
  • Standard Lancom escalation path.
Emergency A change that must be implemented as soon as possible, for example to resolve a major incident or implement a security patch. This change is of such a high priority that it bypasses group and peer review and approval and goes straight to the Authorization state for approval by the CAB approval group. P1 (wake a tech up)
  • Customers cant login to DD.
  • Customers can't log tickets.
  • Known security breach.
  • Full noise

    • (Novel of information about incident).


  • Ticket status updates via phone.
  • Finished with an incident response report (and problem ticket where applicable).
  • No approval required
  • Lancom process for P1
  • Jason He 1st
  • Warwick Eade 2nd
Normal

Any service change that is not a standard change or an emergency change.

Normal change requests follow a prescriptive process which requires two levels of approval before being implemented, reviewed, and closed.

P3

￼(Standard one off projects)


  • Upgrading servers.
  • Moves ads and changes.
  • Get plan signed off.

  • Moderate Tell me when it starts, progress and finish.￼Ask me to check in how it is going.
  • Warwick Eade & Jason He (either or both)
  • Ask as part of the process "Who is approving this?"
  • Standard Lancom escalation
  • Standard DD escalation



To dos:

  • Grab a copy of Lancom's standard escalation path, if non-existing create one (which will include key roles).
  • Update change request form to incorporate key questions from Change Management Framework (BW)
  • Could we use DD to publish change request template?
  • Think about how we will report on standard change management – ISVs & DD still want to know about it and have a log of the change.
  • Low level of changes that can be automated <what are these?>
  • Create tags in CW for change types so these can be reported on.

Specs (Content) for automation (CWE):

  • What forms do we need?
  • Which workflows do we need?
  • What sort of digest information we will report on DD portal?

Change Request Process for NORMAL changes:

  1. Engineer completes change request form
  2. Posts it to the change request channel for internal approval
  3. Sends to customer via email for approval
  4. Customer approves/decline
  5. Change is carried on accordingly




The Change Management process provides a systematic approach to control the life cycle of all changes, facilitating beneficial changes to be made with minimum disruption to IT services.

pages.title: Conditional Access
pages.name: Conditional Access

pages.title: DD-ChangeReq-ConditionalAccess
pages.name: DD-ChangeReq-ConditionalAccess
pages.pageContent:
Subject RE: Security Project
From Cameron Roberts
To Warwick Eade
Cc Priscila Bernardes
Sent Tuesday, 28 July 2020 11:33 AM
Attachments <<DD-ChangeReq-ConditionalAccess.pdf>>

 

Hi Warwick,

 

Can you please review/approve attached change request for Conditional Access policy rollout? (sending to you rather than Jason as identity and not application related).

 

Kind Regards,

Cameron Roberts

Technical Team Leader

Lancom Technology

Follow Us:

 

 

Tel. +64 9 377 8282

Fax. +64 9 377 7900

Cameron.Roberts@lancom.co.nz

29 Enfield Street, Mt Eden

Auckland 1024

New Zealand

 

From: Cameron Roberts

Sent: Friday, 24 July 2020 11:13 PM

To: Warwick Eade <warwick@deskdirector.com>

Cc: Priscila Bernardes <Priscila.Bernardes@lancom.co.nz>

Subject: Security Project

 

Hi Warwick,

 

Just a bit of an update on where we are at with the security project.

 

Defender ATP (Servers)

 

  • All deployed
  • We only had one issue on EU Raven where Defender was not respecting the exclusion on the RavenDB folder and was locking files during scan. This was resolved by removing to registry key for the exclusion and adding manually via the GUI.
  • Other than the issue above, it has been running smoothly
  • We’ve only had a couple of alerts, both were for Labtech running scripts being detected as suspicious scripts – they were legitimate scripts running so were flagged as false positives

 

Conditional Access

 

  • Have reviewed the audit logs (in report only mode), will enable CA policies with exception of the policy to block legacy protocols etc (IMAP currently in use by one login – will investigate further, we may need to exclude this one account temporarily if it’s not an easy fix)
  • I will get a change control request written up before enabling these policies

 

InTune/Defender ATP (Desktops)

 

  • Currently finishing up testing after enabling auto enrolment along with new device policies setup for ATP configuration etc (currently limited to a test group)
  • The new Microsoft Endpoint Management UI hasn’t brought through the devices already enrolled in InTune so we may need to re-enrol them but this shouldn’t be a major issue and auto-enrol should handle this once turned on for everyone

 

 

I will provide a further update next week.

 

Kind Regards,

Cameron Roberts

Technical Team Leader

Lancom Technology

Follow Us:

 

 

Tel. +64 9 377 8282

Fax. +64 9 377 7900

Cameron.Roberts@lancom.co.nz

29 Enfield Street, Mt Eden

Auckland 1024

New Zealand

pages.title: Problem Management
pages.name: Problem Management
pages.pageContent:
Problems are defined as root causes to issues that may or may not have resulted in an incident. These are also defined as issues that may have been resolved (and require further analysis to ensure they do not occur again) or have work around in place (which require a full solution to be created and implemented.)


Problem Detection

How do we detect something is a problem needing review?


  • Suspicious or Repeat issues
  • Issues not documented in Internal or External KB
  • Unexpected Issues raised by monitoring services
  • Major outages




Problem Investigation and Review

How do we investigate the issue with the DeskDirector team?

  • Weekly ticket reviews?
  • Monthly "Swat Team"?

What are the details we need to collect prior?

  • Incident report
  • Who needs to be involved
  • Customers affected
  • Priority of the problem



Outcomes

  • Software Development / Release Plan for any code changes needed
  • Problem Resolution Document to key stakeholders
  • Solution documented, uploaded to DeskDirector HelpDocs or ITGlue and available to end customers / internal staff

pages.name: Performance Monitoring
pages.pageContent:

pages.title: Incident Report Template
pages.name: Incident Report Template

pages.title: Incident Response
pages.name: Incident Response
pages.pageContent:
Service Rankings and Response Times


Severity Low Impact￼[Define what]

Moderate Impact

[Define what]

High Impact

[Define what]
Low ￼(irritation rather than stoppage) P4 P3 P3
Medium￼(Business degraded reasonable workaround) P3 P2 P2
High ￼(Major business process stopped) P2 P1 P1



Problem Severity Initial Response Time Escalation Expected Time to Resolution

P1

Emergency (Business Hours)

 1 business hour 1 business hour Determined by the nature of the event

P2

Quick Response

 2 business hours 4 business hours Determined by the nature of the event

P3

Normal Response

 8 business hours 8 business hours Determined by the nature of the event

P4

Low Priority

 5 business days 5 business days N/A

P5

Scheduled Work

 N/A N/A N/A

Priority Examples


Priority 1 ￼What is happening to your customers that we should wake people up for? ￼<Customer centric>


  • Customers can't log tickets <for whatever reason>
  • Security breach <foreigners on the servers>

Priority 2 (Getting people up earlier in the am)

  • What are the behaviors that customers can't do?
  • Can't see tickets
  • Can't search tickets
  • Customers are not getting email notifications
  • Speed threshold < longer than 5 seconds to update>
  • Customer sign ups not working
  • Critical security <patching>



Priority 3 (Unscheduled)

  • CPU running low but servers still going
  • Moves ads and changes
  • Out of band releases ￼

Priority 4 (Scheduled)

  • Scheduled events (scheduled releases)
  • Moves, adds and changes
  • Customer Offboarding



Escalation Path

Our standard escalation path is detailed below. This lays out a plan that all our team can follow to ensure timely review and completion of tickets. It also provides a path for escalation that can be accelerated at any time in the process.


The escalation team will include members of the DeskDirector Development team.

 2 business hours 4 business hours Determined by the nature of the event

P3

Normal Response

 8 business hours 8 business hours Determined by the nature of the event

P4

Low Priority

 5 business days 5 business days N/A

P5

Scheduled Work

 N/A N/A N/A

Priority Examples


Priority 1 ￼What is happening to your customers that we should wake people up for? ￼<Customer centric>


  • Customers can't log tickets <for whatever reason>
  • Security breach <foreigners on the servers>

Priority 2 (Getting people up earlier in the am)

  • What are the behaviors that customers can't do?
  • Can't see tickets
  • Can't search tickets
  • Customers are not getting email notifications
  • Speed threshold < longer than 5 seconds to update>
  • Customer sign ups not working
  • Critical security <patching>



Priority 3 (Unscheduled)

  • CPU running low but servers still going
  • Moves ads and changes
  • Out of band releases ￼

Priority 4 (Scheduled)

  • Scheduled events (scheduled releases)
  • Moves, adds and changes
  • Customer Offboarding



Escalation Path

Our standard escalation path is detailed below. This lays out a plan that all our team can follow to ensure timely review and completion of tickets. It also provides a path for escalation that can be accelerated at any time in the process.


The escalation team will include members of the DeskDirector Development team.

pages.title: Problem Management
pages.name: Problem Management
pages.pageContent:
Problems are defined as root causes to issues that may or may not have resulted in an incident. These are also defined as issues that may have been resolved (and require further analysis to ensure they do not occur again) or have work around in place (which require a full solution to be created and implemented.)


Problem Detection

How do we detect something is a problem needing review?


  • Suspicious or Repeat issues
  • Issues not documented in Internal or External KB
  • Unexpected Issues raised by monitoring services
  • Major outages




Problem Investigation and Review

How do we investigate the issue with the DeskDirector team?

  • Weekly ticket reviews?
  • Monthly "Swat Team"?

What are the details we need to collect prior?

  • Incident report
  • Who needs to be involved
  • Customers affected
  • Priority of the problem



Outcomes

  • Software Development / Release Plan for any code changes needed
  • Problem Resolution Document to key stakeholders
  • Solution documented, uploaded to DeskDirector HelpDocs or ITGlue and available to end customers / internal staff

pages.title: Deployment
pages.name: Deployment
pages.pageContent:
• How do you release builds for your application?

  • How do you roll out your application for customers?

    • 90% of new sign up is completed via script with the application. (Documentation)

    • The last steps are completed manually at this stage

      • Enable Master Admin
      • Add email domain to DD4DD Support Site
      • Send Welcome/Confirmation Email

    • Note: Previous Customers

      • There is an issue where previous customers can have issues when they come back onboard as the system is based upon Connectwise
      • Connectwise does not delete records, only disables
      • Offboarding process may need to be reviewed to take this into account






  • How do you roll back?

    • Do you have self-heal process? Is there anything Lancom can assist with on this?
    • Do you roll back from backups?

    • Do you have some sort of software you use to roll back?

      • Manage-Core is used for Automated Rollback



  • What can be improved and by who?

DeskDirector Portal New Release Upgrades

  • Details under Change Management Tab
  • Latest Update deployed to support.deskdirector.com and lancomdev.deskdirector.com first every Monday
  • AU region sites upgraded Wednesday following
  • US / CA / EU region sites upgraded Monday following AU

pages.title: Patching Regime
pages.name: Patching Regime
pages.pageContent:
Windows Server Updates

Windows Server Patching is completed automatically via AWS Systems Manager. This system processes all updates for servers within the specific regions to ensure consistency across the platform.


Patch windows have been selected with Jason and Warwick to ensure minimal downtime for end clients and consistent access to Raven Databases.


Patch Windows: 2 hours, region dependent

  • AU: Saturday's 12:00pm UTC (Saturday 10pm AEST)
  • CA: Sunday 10:00pm UTC
  • US: Sunday 3:00pm UTC
  • EU: Sunday 5:00pm UTC

Exclusions:

  • All Windows 2012 Preview Updates

Notes:


  • Script to shut down RavenDB has been created by Jason. Raven MUST be cleanly shutdown prior to rebooting any servers.

pages.title: Source Management Deployment
pages.name: Source Management Deployment
pages.pageContent:
• Repository (where is the code stored?, how often is it stored?, do you use GitHub and understand how it works? Do you have a review process?) ￼
  • Daily commits, risks￼
  • Code health: how complex, how easy to add additional team members, code sustainability , code coverage, unit test (is there any?)

pages.pageContent:
What is running on cloud?

What services are you using?

How do you scale?

Do you have a dev, staging, prototype, and demo environments?

pages.title: Third Party Vendors
pages.name: Third Party Vendors
pages.pageContent:
Designers, Testers, contractors –who do you have on your books?


Key vendors and partnerships in place (e.g. We are a Microsoft partner)


What are the workflows your software interacts with? (e.g. DD interacts with CW)

  • Connectwise (DeskDirector Instance)
  • Connectwise
  • Autotask
  • ConnectBooster
  • WisePay
  • QuoteWerks
  • Wufoo
  • AuthAnvil
  • Microsoft Flow
  • Chargify



What workflows your software sits in?


What APIs do you rely on?

pages.title: Security Model
pages.name: Security Model
pages.pageContent:
• Threat model (what are we protecting against?)

    • Perimeter protection
    • Bad Actor (Customer)
    • Bad Actor internal (Staff, Contractor)
    • External third party attack.


Outcome: An outline of the threats we are and are not protecting against


  • Damages "What is the worst that can happen?"

  • Encryption - What is in place

    • In transit
    • At rest￼
  • Third Party Testing: Do you have anyone testing your security for you?

  • Bunker Backup: Do you have anything in place? (e.g.Crypto locker)

  • What is your tolerance for data loss? (RTO, RPO etc)

  • Business Disaster Recovery: What happens if you lose AWS?

pages.title: Third Party Vendors
pages.name: Third Party Vendors
pages.pageContent:
Designers, Testers, contractors –who do you have on your books?


Key vendors and partnerships in place (e.g. We are a Microsoft partner)


What are the workflows your software interacts with? (e.g. DD interacts with CW)

  • Connectwise (DeskDirector Instance)
  • Connectwise
  • Autotask

  • QuoteWerks

pages.title: Security Model
pages.name: Security Model
pages.pageContent:
• Threat model (what are we protecting against?)

    • Perimeter protection
    • Bad Actor (Customer)
    • Bad Actor internal (Staff, Contractor)
    • External third party attack.


Outcome: An outline of the threats we are and are not protecting against


  • Damages "What is the worst that can happen?"

  • Encryption - What is in place

    • In transit
    • At rest￼
  • Third Party Testing: Do you have anyone testing your security for you?

  • Bunker Backup: Do you have anything in place? (e.g.Crypto locker)

  • What is your tolerance for data loss? (RTO, RPO etc)

  • Business Disaster Recovery: What happens if you lose AWS?
